# We build financial technologies to improve access, process efficiency, and portfolio management.
Our flagship products are Velex and Atlas.
Founded in 2017, Grain emerged from our personal experience with the limitations of traditional credit structures. Determined to democratize credit, we reimagined how credit decisions are made and developed a solution that expanded opportunities for consumers. Over 6 years, our [consumer credit app ↗](https://trygrain.com/</consumers>) grew to serve 470K users.Building on our consumer finance experience and learnings from financial institution partners, in 2023, we transitioned to concentrate fully on two new products, Velex and Atlas.

generated_description:
Grain is a fintech startup based in Oakland, California, that’s shaking up the traditional credit landscape. Born in 2017 out of the founders’ frustration with conventional credit systems, Grain’s mission is to transform debit cards into credit cards by linking them to a line of credit informed by real cash flow. This offers a lifeline to millennials, Gen Zs, and immigrants—essentially, about 100 million people—who often fear falling into the quagmire of credit card debt.

After initially rolling out their consumer credit app—which for six years served around 470,000 users—Grain pivoted in 2023 to focus on two new flagship products: **Velex** and **Atlas**. Velex provides an automated cash-flow scoring solution, allowing financial institutions to assess borrower risk more effectively, while Atlas serves as a comprehensive portfolio management tool for various loan types and credit services.

Grain stands out not just for its innovative approach but also for its commitment to financial inclusivity. By simplifying access to credit, they’re aiming to democratize financial opportunities for those previously marginalized by traditional banking norms. With a team of 30, Grain is part of Y Combinator's Batch W20, suggesting that they’re not just a vision, but a startup with the backing and potential to make significant waves in the finance sector.

If you’re looking for a fresh perspective on credit options and financial management, Grain seems well-poised to be a player worth watching.  

You can explore more about their offerings at [trygrain.com](https://trygrain.com).
